If you've found the specs for the monitor (as provided by the manufacturer), you can update /etc/X11/xorg.conf with the values and get more options.
i took a look at the xorg.conf and its detected my monitor as a dell

Well, the type doesn't really do anything except try to provide information on what's safe (in terms of signal speed) to the monitor.
Take a look at the same sort of issue I had at https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/xorg/+bug/180601
All you have to do is look up the monitor's specs and enter the extra lines into xorg.conf.
You may need to restart X for them to take effect. (CTRL-ALT-Backspace)
Don't forget to back up xorg.conf before changing it! If it goes wrong, you can change it back on a tty terminal.
